text: [Music]
first let me lament the fact that we can
ask any one of us in any room I don't
care what age you are provided you
you're done with school and ask how many
teachers of all the teachers you've had
in life for most people that would be
like scores of teachers you know is it
70 80 100 teachers
some maybe as few as 50 or 40 but still
in the high
tens ask among all your teachers how
many made a singular impact in your life
how many changed you in fundamental
important ways unfortunately the answer
to that question is almost always no
more than this two three at most five
for me that numberers three and that's
not
unusual so what is what gives here
by the way they wouldn't have to be
science teachers I'm talking about
teachers in any subject and what makes
those teachers special is that you could
have no interest in the subject going in
and you come out and it's the most
interesting thing you've ever heard in
your life those teachers convey
something special within their students
an enthusiasm an excitement a
passion so one of my great laments is
that education today seems to have be
less about passion and more about
process more
about tactic or Tech
technique I but I don't know anybody who
said boy I love that teacher he or she
gave a really good homework set or boy
that was the best class I ever took
because those exams were awesome that's
not what people want to talk about
that's not what influences people in one
profession or another it's it's how well
the instructor imparted their passion
for their subject in their
students and just extend this to the
Sciences
we all know people who were turned off
by science because they had a bad
teacher that's the worst case the
teacher the teacher now has the opposite
effect of what education ought to be so
I don't know what to do do we rifle
through the educational system and like
get rid of those teachers and clone the
others I I don't have an easy Silver
Bullet there but I do know but that
shouldn't prevent me from citing at
least part of what the problem is I want
to see more impassioned teachers than
